titleStmt.title: TO THE RIGHT Honorable WILLIAM Earle of Pembroke, Lord High Chamberlaine; CHANCELLOVR of the Vniuersitie of Oxford; One of his MAIESTIES most Honorable Priuy Counsell.
titleStmt.author: Hall, Joseph

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: TO THE RIGHT Honorable WILLIAM Earle of Pembroke, Lord High Chamberlaine; CHANCELLOVR of the Vniuersitie of Oxford; One of his MAIESTIES most Honorable Priuy Counsell.
analytic.author: Hall, Joseph

monogr.title: The best bargaine : A sermon preached to the Court at Theobalds. on Sunday, Sept. 21. 1623. By Ios. Hall D.D
monogr.author: Hall, Joseph

div.head: TO THE RIGHT Honorable WILLIAM Earle of Pembroke, Lord High Chamberlaine; CHANCELLOVR of the Vniuersitie of Oxford; One of his MAIESTIES most Honorable Priuy Counsell.

body.p:
LEt it please you to receiue from the Presse what you vouchsafed to require from my pen: Vnworthy I confesse either of the publike light, or the beames of your
Honours iudicious eies; yet such as (besides the motiue of common importunity) I easily apprehended might be not a little vs full for the times; which, if euer, require quickning: Neither is it to no purpose that the world should see in what stile wee speake to the Court, not without acceptation. This, and what euer seruice I may be capable of, are iustly deuoted to your Lordship, whom all good hearts follow with true Honour, as the great Patron of learning, the sincere friend of Religion, and rich purchaser of Truth. The God of Heauen adde to the number of such Peeres, and to the measure of your Lo: graces and happinesse.

closer.signed: Your Honors in all humble and faithfull obseruance, Ios: Hall.
